alert.note: Alert for Municipality of Skagway (Alaska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Wind Chill Advisory issued January 10 at 2:36AM AKST until January 12 at 6:00AM AKST by NWS Juneau
info.description: ...VERY COLD TEMPERATURES AND WIND CHILLS THIS WEEK... .The first significant outflow event of the season will continue to decrease temperatures and wind chills with each passing night through Thursday night. Northerly winds of 20 to 30 mph with gusts of 40 to 50 mph will continue through the week. Strongest winds will remain near Lynn Canal. Low temperatures will drop to 10 degrees below zero at higher elevations along the Klondike Highway with wind chills dropping to 30 to 40 below. Winds chills will rise during the daytime hours but then drop once again to 30 below or lower by the evening into the early morning. ...WIND CHILL ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 6 AM AKST FRIDAY... * WHAT...Very cold wind chills. Wind chills as low as 40 below zero. * WHERE...Municipality of Skagway. * WHEN...Until 6 AM AKST Friday. * IMPACTS...The dangerously cold wind chills could cause frostbite on exposed skin in as little as 10 minutes. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Temperatures will increase during the day but drop again by the evening and into the overnight hours.
info.instruction: Use caution while traveling outside. Wear appropriate clothing, a hat, and gloves.
